thread.title: Bethel Park kicker Tischler embraces first-ever season of football
thread.title_full: Bethel Park kicker Tischler embraces first-ever season of football

title: Bethel Park kicker Tischler embraces first-ever season of football
text:
GM recalls SUVs, tells owners not to use windshield wipers 
“I thought football would be that challenge for me.” 
After a little consideration, Tischler took herself up that challenge, joining the team as the field goal and extra point kicker. 
Heading into Week 6, the Blackhawks are riding a three-game winning streak after dropping their first two games of the season. With the team’s early struggles, Tischler learned a valuable life lesson to never give up. 
“One thing I’ve learned about football is that if you miss, you have to figure out what’s wrong and go forward,” she said. 
Even though she’s the only girl on the team, Tischler was easily embraced by the rest of the Blackhawks roster. 
“The boys have been great toward me,” she said. “I’m just one of the kids on the team.” 
With more than half of her only football season behind her, Tischler has no regrets about making the move into a sport mainly dominated by males. 
“It’s taught me a lot about teamwork and hard work. I wouldn’t want to spend my senior season anywhere else,” she said. Sign up for our WPXI-TV Daily Headlines Newsletter Sign Up
